intro: Carruanthus, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are typically found in rocky or alpine environments, where they thrive in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Carruanthus species are characterized by their compact growth habit, often forming dense mats or cushions. Their flowers are usually small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from white to pink and purple. The genus includes several species, many of which are endemic to specific regions in South America.
